CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code provides that the appeal instance examines appeals with a view to verifying the lawfulness , validity and fairness of judgments . CARDINAL . Examining the compatibility of LAW , the Constitutional Court ruled as follows ( decision no . CARDINAL-O of DATE ) :

“ LAW , which describes the circumstances in which the participation of defence counsel is mandatory , does not contain any indication that its requirements are not applicable in appeal proceedings or that the convict ’s right to legal assistance in such proceedings may be restricted . ”

CARDINAL . That position was subsequently confirmed and developed in CARDINAL decisions delivered by ORG on DATE . It found that free legal assistance for the purpose of appellate proceedings should be provided on the same conditions as during the earlier stages in the proceedings and is mandatory in situations listed in LAW . It further underlined the obligation of courts to secure participation of defence counsel in appeal proceedings .
